addressFamily.description: IP address family. Example: ipv4 | ipv6.

protocol.description: TCP/IP protocol as defined in the list of IP protocol numbers. Example: 255 (any) | 0 | 1.

sequenceNumber.description: sequenceNumber of the Access Control List.

administrativeState.description: Administrative state of the BfdConfiguration. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

expressRouteAuthorizationKey.description: Authorization key for the circuit, must be of type Microsoft.Network/expressRouteCircuits/authorizations. The Auth Key is a mandatory attribute.

expressRouteCircuitId.description: The express route circuit Azure resource ID, must be of type Microsoft.Network/expressRouteCircuits/circuitName. The ExpressRoute Circuit is a mandatory attribute.

ExpressRouteConnectionInformation.description: The ExpressRoute circuit ID and the Auth Key are required for you to successfully deploy NFC service.

administrativeState.description: AdministrativeState of the externalNetwork. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

mtu.description: MTU to use for option A peering.

primaryIpv4Prefix.description: IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.23.1.0/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

primaryIpv6Prefix.description: IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a1/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv4Prefix.description: Secondary IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.23.1.2/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv6Prefix.description: Secondary IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a1/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

allowAS.description: Allows for routes to be received and processed even if the router detects its own ASN in the AS-Path. 0 is disable, Possible values are 1-10, default is 2.

nextHop.description: List of next hop IPv4 addresses.
List of next hop IPv6 addresses.

administrativeState.description: Administrative state of the InternalNetwork. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

mtu.description: Maximum transmission unit. Default value is 1500.

localAS.description: Local Autonomous System. Example: true | false.

communityMember.description: communityMember of the Ip Community List. Example: 100:200

evpnEsImportRouteTarget.description: evpnEsImportRouteTarget of the Ip Community List. Example: 100:400

sequenceNumber.description: sequenceNumber of the Ip Prefix List.

mtu.description: maximum transmission unit. Default value is 1500.

L3IsolationDomainPatchPropertiesAggregat.description: List of Ipv4 and Ipv6 route configurations.

prefix.description: IPv4 Prefix of the aggregate Ipv4Route.
IPv6 Prefix of the aggregate IPv6 Route.

administrativeState.description: Enabled/Disabled connected subnet route policy. Ex: Enabled | Disabled.
Administrative state of the IsolationDomain. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

aggregateRouteConfiguration.description: List of Ipv4 and Ipv6 route configurations.

peerASN.description: ASN of PE devices for CE/PE connectivity.Example : 28

primaryIpv4Prefix.description: IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.31.0.0/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

primaryIpv6Prefix.description: IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a0/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv4Prefix.description: Secondary IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 172.31.0.20/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv6Prefix.description: Secondary IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Default value is 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a4/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

hostName.description: The host Name of the device.

networkDeviceRole.description: networkDeviceRole is the device role: Example: CE | ToR.

serialNumber.description: serialNumber of the format Make;Model;HardwareRevisionId;SerialNumber. Example: Arista;DCS-7280DR3-24;12.05;JPE21116969

infrastructureExpressRouteConnections.description: As part of an update, the Infrastructure ExpressRoute CircuitID should be provided to create and Provision a NFC. This Express route is dedicated for Infrastructure services. (This is a Mandatory attribute)

ipv4AddressSpace.description: IPv4 Network Fabric Controller Address Space.

ipv6AddressSpace.description: IPv6 Network Fabric Controller Address Space.

workloadExpressRouteConnections.description: As part of an update, the workload ExpressRoute CircuitID should be provided to create and Provision a NFC. This Express route is dedicated for Workload services. (This is a Mandatory attribute).

name.description: The NFC service will be hosted in a Managed resource group.

fabricASN.description: ASN of CE devices for CE/PE connectivity.

ipv4Prefix.description: IPv4Prefix for Management Network. Default value : 10.1.0.0/19.

ipv6Prefix.description: IPv6Prefix for Management Network. Default value 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD40::/59.

managementNetworkConfiguration.description: Configuration to be used to setup the management network.

networkFabricControllerId.description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkFabricController the NetworkFabric belongs.

networkFabricSku.description: Supported Network Fabric SKU.Example: Compute / Aggregate racks. Once the user chooses a particular SKU, only supported racks can be added to the Network Fabric. The SKU determines whether it is a single / multi rack Network Fabric.

operationalState.description: Gets the operational state of the resource.

provisioningState.description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

rackCount.description: Number of racks associated to Network Fabric.Possible values are from 2-8.

serverCountPerRack.description: Number of servers.Possible values are from 1-16.

terminalServerConfiguration.description: Network and credentials configuration currently applied to terminal server.

NetworkFabricPropertiesManagementNetwork.description: Configuration to be used to setup the management network.

administrativeState.description: Indicates configuration state. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

optionBProperties.description: Option B configuration to be used for management vpn.

administrativeState.description: Indicates configuration state. Example: enabled | disabled.

optionBProperties.description: Option B configuration to be used for management vpn.

password.description: Password for the terminal server connection.

administrativeState.description: administrativeState of the network interface. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

isManagementType.description: Configuration to use NNI for Infrastructure Management. Example: True/False.

provisioningState.description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

useOptionB.description: Based on this parameter the layer2/layer3 is made as mandatory. Example: True/False.

mtu.description: MTU of the packets between PE & CE.

portCount.description: Number of ports connected between PE/CE. Maximum value depends on FabricSKU.
